intro: Symphyandra wanneri, commonly known as the Wanner's symphyandra, is a rare and unique plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its distinctive floral structure. The plant features a basal rosette of leaves and produces umbel-like inflorescences with small, white to pale yellow flowers. Its botanical significance lies in its role as a relict species, offering insights into ancient plant evolution. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered endangered and requires conservation efforts to ensure its survival.
